p: During the 2014–16, Ebola epidemic, over 11,000 deaths with approximately 28,000 infected people, and the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS-CoV) of 2002–2003 with infected people in more than thirty countries on five continents infected 8000 people and caused 774 deaths. The Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Corona Viruses (MERS-CoV) caused 866 humans deaths. All three of these EIDs were ‘zoonotic’.
